intro: Rochelia asperata, commonly known as the rough rochelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Rochelia asperata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
